column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples with nominal compositions of Sr2CuO3.4 were synthesized from SrO2, CuO and the precursor of Sr2CuO3 under high pressure and high temperature.
#Text=The precursor Sr2CuO3 was prepared by solid-state reaction with high pure SrCO3 and CuO mixed at a molar ratio of 2:1 and was sintered at 950 °C for 12 h with several intermediate grindings.
#Text=To obtain high quality of the sample (i.e., much higher superconducting volume fraction), we change the synthesis condition which is different from reported previously [9].
#Text=At first, the sample was synthesized at the pressure of 5.5 GPa and temperature of 850 °C for 30 min, followed by keeping at the same pressure but temperature at 450 °C for 60 min.
#Text=This high pressure low temperature annealing is expected to enhance the apical oxygen ordering.

#Text=The DC magnetic susceptibility was measured using a superconducting quantum interference device (SQUID) magnetometer in an external magnetic field of 30 Oe for both zero-field-cooling (ZFC) and field-cooling (FC) modes.
#Text=The resistivity was measured using standard four-probe method with a MAGLAB system.
#Text=A Tecnai F20 electron microscope with a field emission gun was used for electron diffraction experiments.
